meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stable.
meanings.sent1: The stabilities of the table ensured it wouldn't wobble.
meanings.sent2: The stabilities of the building made it safe to enter.
meanings.sent3: The stabilities of the jello surprised everyone when it didn't wobble.
meanings.sent4: Her stabilities in decision-making were like a rock in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The stabilities of the mountain were awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: The ability to remain unchanged or constant.
meanings.sent1: The stabilities of the clock kept it ticking accurately.
meanings.sent2: The financial stabilities of the company were reassuring to investors.
meanings.sent3: The stabilities of the weather forecast were surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: His stabilities in routine were like a steady heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The stabilities of the old tree were a testament to time's passage.

meanings.definition: The resistance to sudden changes or deterioration.
meanings.sent1: The stabilities of the ship helped it withstand the storm.
meanings.sent2: The emotional stabilities of the team kept them focused under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The stabilities of the ice cream in the sun were put to the test.
meanings.sent4: Her stabilities in crisis were like a shield against chaos.
meanings.sent5: The stabilities of the bridge prevented its collapse during the earthquake.
